boat.name: Cailleach Dhubh
boat.full_description:
'Cailleach Dhubh' was built by Gaffers & Luggers in 1989 and bought by Denys Mitchell in 2007. Since then, she has been sailed extensively on the west coast of Scotland.

Following a survey in March 2012, she was described as 'A traditional, heavy displacement vessel based on the Falmouth working vessels understood to be still in production.'
boat.short_description: Built by Gaffers & Luggers, Tregatreath Boatyard, Cornwall in 1989, 'Cailleach Dhubh' is a Heard 23 gaff cutter based on the Falmouth working vessels.

for_sales.sales_text:
The builder, of this beautifully maintained yacht, is Gaffers & Luggers, Tregatreath Boatyard in Cornwall. Her builders plate number is 2834. Having been sailed, extensively, around the West Coast of Scotland, she is looking for a good home and an owner who would appreciate her distinctive lines.

She was surveyed in March 2012 and the summary statement is, quote: 'A traditional, heavy displacement vessel based on the Falmouth working vessels and is understood to be still in production. This example has been with the present owner since 2007 and has thereafter been completely fitted out to his liking. The work has been carried out to a high standard resulting in an attractive, quality traditional cruiser'.

She has many traditional features including oil navigation lights which are fully functional. Viewing is highly recommended.
